content.description: Follow a seam and shallow crack up and then 6 feet left then move in to a shallow corner with a crack in the back. The crux is moving right about one-third of the way up
content.protection: Small wires and cams in the lower section midsize in the upper section. With out the right gear this can become easily an R route, be careful.
content.location: On the Quay the left side.Â  There is a fixed pin at the base.

content.description: A nice inside corner with good cracks on the side walls. The bushes are easily avoided.
content.location: On the West face, southern end of the Santa Maria

content.description: The route goes over several roofs then goes straight up to the summit. The protection is very good and it has several good hand cracks. The crux is clearing the first real roof.
content.location: The route in on the East face, near the center. Start at the base of a large roof in the corner.

content.description: The start is a bit tricky face climbing but after that just head straight up jamming to the roof and pull over it.
content.protection: standard rack except for the start which need smaller wired or small off set cams.
content.location: West face of the Santa Maria just up hill from the low roofs about 10 feet before the corner.

content.description: First pitch; a hand/fist crack to a very nice large belay ledge,(5.8). Pitch 2; On the corner of the north and east face is a inside corner with a finger crack, climb up following the crack system to the top, (5.10). You can 3rd class or continue climbing the the actual summit. The crux is getting to some great holds after the lay back where the crack is too small for fingers, this 8 foot section is tricky but well protected.
content.protection: Standard rack plus some small cams or wired nuts.
content.location: The route starts on a large platform on the narrow north face,.

content.description: Start below the fixed lost arrow for wingspan climb up and once your at the pin move left. then limb up the crack with some plants in it.  The crux is  the mantel of may be a bit above it where the crack gets tight. The climb is fairly consistent with good rests along the way and good protection, it loves wired stoppers. The lower section is a bit thin on protection betre the 5.8 sections. Mostly fingers and hands route with some key face climbing moves.
content.protection: Standard pro plus a few small cams or wired stoppers
content.location: It is about 10 feet left of Wingspan on the flat face of the quay. Walk off.  Also this route can easily be top-roped.

content.description: A pinnacle to the west of Knife Blade, and south of Tombstone, Includes, the Quay that is behind the main Pinnacle and the bridge which connects them. Its about 80 meters tall.
